title: FALSE: Sotto files charges against Duque, Morales
subtitle: The Senate committee of the whole only recommended filing complaints against the officials, for the consideration of the Department of Justice and the Ombudsman
author: rappler.com
vclaim:
The Senate committee of the whole only recommended filing complaints against the officials, for the consideration of the Department of Justice (DOJ) and the Ombudsman.

Facebook pages as well as websites posted a video uploaded by YouTube channel PH BREAKING NEWS, entitled, "CONFIRMED: ITO ANG NAKAKA-BULAGA SEN. SOTTO KINASUHAN na si DUQUE at MORALES at LAHAT SA PHILHEALTH!" (Confirmed: This is shocking, Senator Sotto filed charges against Duque, Morales, and everyone in PhilHealth!)

Both videos contained an excerpt of the Senate session on September 1, wherein Sotto read the salient parts of the Senate committee of the whole's report on the alleged rampant corruption in PhilHealth. (READ: CHEAT SHEET: Alleged PhilHealth anomalies uncovered in Congress probes)

In the report, the senators recommended the prosecution of Duque, Morales, and other top PhilHealth officials. For Duque, Morales, and 3 other PhilHealth officials, in particular, the Senate recommended the following complaints:

According to the DOJ, any prosecutions of PhilHealth officers, employees, and other suspects will be made through the task force and with the endorsement of Justice Secretary Menardo Guevarra. Only the prosecutors of the DOJ or the Office of the Ombudsman can file charges against those involved in the allegations.

One of the YouTube channels that posted this claim has a history of posting false content. At least two other videos uploaded by PH BREAKING NEWS have been fact-checked by Rappler in the past. – Loreben Tuquero/Rappler.com

Keep us aware of suspicious Facebook pages, groups, accounts, websites, articles, or photos in your network by contacting us at factcheck@rappler.com. Let us battle disinformation one Fact Check at a time.
